comments.body:
this also "broke" the output locations AFAICT, 

`bazel-bin/cmd/kubelet/linux_amd64_stripped/kubelet` -> `bazel-bin/cmd/kubelet/kubelet`

`bazel-bin/cmd/kubelet/linux_amd64_stripped` has this now `bazel-bin/cmd/kubelet/linux_amd64_stripped/_kubelet-cgo%/k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kubelet.a`

actually only for kubelet, the pure binaries appear to be the same.

I worked around this in https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kind/pull/335, but kubernetes-anywhere jobs are broken by this I think.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +20,24 @@# be a pure go binary otherwise. Additionally, if targeting Windows, the
# output filename will have a .exe suffix.
def go_binary_conditional_pure(name, tags = None, **kwargs):
    tags = tags or []
    tags.append("manual")
